revised_title: On a Self-Recovering Coherer and the Study of Cohering Action of Different Metals
tldr: The authors studied the cohering action of different metals and their sensitivity to electric radiation. They discovered that some metals, like potassium, exhibit an increase in resistance when exposed to electric waves, while others, like magnesium, show a decrease in resistance. They also found that a self-recovering coherer can be made by using metals less prone to oxidation and adjusting the pressure and E.M.F. to control the response.
